verses.verse: To the chief Musician <S%H5329><s%> on Neginoth, <S%H5058><s%> Maschil, <S%H4905><s%> A Psalm of David. <S%H1732><s%> Give ear <S%H238><s%> to my prayer, <S%H8605><s%> O God; <S%H430><s%> and hide not thyself <S%H408><s%> <S%H5956><s%> from my supplication. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H8467><s%>
Attend <S%H7181><s%> unto me, and hear <S%H6030><s%> me: I mourn <S%H7300><s%> in my complaint, <S%H7879><s%> and make a noise; <S%H1949><s%>

Because of the voice <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6963><s%> of the enemy, <S%H341><s%> because <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%> of the oppression <S%H6125><s%> of the wicked: <S%H7563><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> they cast <S%H4131><s%> iniquity <S%H205><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> me, and in wrath <S%H639><s%> they hate <S%H7852><s%> me.
My heart <S%H3820><s%> is sore pained <S%H2342><s%> within <S%H7130><s%> me: and the terrors <S%H367><s%> of death <S%H4194><s%> are fallen <S%H5307><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> me.
Fearfulness <S%H3374><s%> and trembling <S%H7461><s%> are come <S%H935><s%> upon me, and horror <S%H6427><s%> hath overwhelmed <S%H3680><s%> me.
And I said, <S%H559><s%> Oh that <S%H4310><s%> I had <S%H5414><s%> wings <S%H83><s%> like a dove! <S%H3123><s%> for then would I fly away, <S%H5774><s%> and be at rest. <S%H7931><s%>
Lo, <S%H2009><s%> then would I wander <S%H5074><s%> far off, <S%H7368><s%> and remain <S%H3885><s%> in the wilderness. <S%H4057><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
I would hasten <S%H2363><s%> my escape <S%H4655><s%> from the windy <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7307><s%> storm <S%H5584><s%> and tempest. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5591><s%>

Destroy, <S%H1104><s%> O Lord, <S%H136><s%> and divide <S%H6385><s%> their tongues: <S%H3956><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> I have seen <S%H7200><s%> violence <S%H2555><s%> and strife <S%H7379><s%> in the city. <S%H5892><s%>

Day <S%H3119><s%> and night <S%H3915><s%> they go about <S%H5437><s%> it upon <S%H5921><s%> the walls <S%H2346><s%> thereof: mischief <S%H205><s%> also and sorrow <S%H5999><s%> are in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of it.
Wickedness <S%H1942><s%> is in the midst <S%H7130><s%> thereof: deceit <S%H8496><s%> and guile <S%H4820><s%> depart <S%H4185><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> her streets. <S%H7339><s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> it was not <S%H3808><s%> an enemy <S%H341><s%> that reproached <S%H2778><s%> me; then I could have borne <S%H5375><s%> it: neither <S%H3808><s%> was it he that hated <S%H8130><s%> me that did magnify <S%H1431><s%> himself against <S%H5921><s%> me; then I would have hid myself <S%H5641><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> him:
But it was thou, <S%H859><s%> a man <S%H582><s%> mine equal, <S%H6187><s%> my guide, <S%H441><s%> and mine acquaintance. <S%H3045><s%>
We took sweet <S%H4985><s%> counsel <S%H5475><s%> together, <S%H3162><s%> and walked <S%H1980><s%> unto the house <S%H1004><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> in company. <S%H7285><s%>

Let death <S%H4194><s%> seize <S%H5377><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> them, and let them go down <S%H3381><s%> quick <S%H2416><s%> into hell: <S%H7585><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> wickedness <S%H7451><s%> is in their dwellings, <S%H4033><s%> and among <S%H7130><s%> them.
As for me, I <S%H589><s%> will call <S%H7121><s%> upon <S%H413><s%> God; <S%H430><s%> and the LORD <S%H3068><s%> shall save <S%H3467><s%> me.
Evening, <S%H6153><s%> and morning, <S%H1242><s%> and at noon, <S%H6672><s%> will I pray, <S%H7878><s%> and cry aloud: <S%H1993><s%> and he shall hear <S%H8085><s%> my voice. <S%H6963><s%>

He hath delivered <S%H6299><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> in peace <S%H7965><s%> from the battle <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7128><s%> that was against me: for <S%H3588><s%> there were <S%H1961><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> with <S%H5978><s%> me.

God <S%H410><s%> shall hear, <S%H8085><s%> and afflict <S%H6031><s%> them, even he that abideth <S%H3427><s%> of old. <S%H6924><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%> Because <S%H834><s%> they have no <S%H369><s%> changes, <S%H2487><s%> therefore they fear <S%H3372><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> God. <S%H430><s%>
He hath put forth <S%H7971><s%> his hands <S%H3027><s%> against such as be at peace <S%H7965><s%> with him: he hath broken <S%H2490><s%> his covenant. <S%H1285><s%>

The words of his mouth <S%H6310><s%> were smoother <S%H2505><s%> than butter, <S%H4260><s%> but war <S%H7128><s%> was in his heart: <S%H3820><s%> his words <S%H1697><s%> were softer <S%H7401><s%> than oil, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H8081><s%> yet were they <S%H1992><s%> drawn swords. <S%H6609><s%>

Cast <S%H7993><s%> thy burden <S%H3053><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> and he <S%H1931><s%> shall sustain <S%H3557><s%> thee: he shall never <S%H3808><s%> <S%H5769><s%> suffer <S%H5414><s%> the righteous <S%H6662><s%> to be moved. <S%H4131><s%>

But thou, <S%H859><s%> O God, <S%H430><s%> shalt bring them down <S%H3381><s%> into the pit <S%H875><s%> of destruction: <S%H7845><s%> bloody <S%H1818><s%> and deceitful <S%H4820><s%> men <S%H376><s%> shall not <S%H3808><s%> live out half <S%H2673><s%> their days; <S%H3117><s%> but I <S%H589><s%> will trust <S%H982><s%> in thee.
